title: Man arrested in Hong Kong over smoking products, 30kg of drugs found in luggage
summary: Hong Kong customs officers have arrested a man who flew in from the Netherlands after 30kg (66lbs) of suspected ketamine and smoking products worth about HK$12 million (US$152,870) were found in his luggage.
fullContent: Hong Kong customs officers have arrested a man who flew in from the Netherlands after 30kg (66lbs) of suspected ketamine and smoking products worth about HK$12 million (US$152,870) were found in his luggage. The 37-year-old man arrived in Hong Kong on Wednesday on a flight from Amsterdam. During clearance, officers from the Customs and Excise Department discovered what they believed were 30kg of ketamine, nine boxes of nicotine pouches containing Part I poison nicotine, and four alternative...

title: Bailey Says Reaction to ‘Finely Balanced’ BOE Cut No Surprise

fullContent: Bank of England Governor Andrew Bailey declared he is not surprised that markets scaled back bets on future interest-rate cuts on Thursday, saying the situation is “very finely balanced.”

title: Trump to Require More College Admissions Data Reporting
summary: President Donald Trump will sign an executive action requiring colleges and universities that receive federal financial assistance to offer greater admissions data transparency, as the administration takes aim at schools’ efforts to boost diversity on their campuses.
fullContent: President Donald Trump will sign an executive action requiring colleges and universities that receive federal financial assistance to offer greater admissions data transparency, as the administration takes aim at schools’ efforts to boost diversity on their campuses.

title: Kremlin Aide: Meeting Between Putin and Trump Expected in Coming Days
summary: A top Kremlin aide says President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump will meet in the "coming days" after the Russian leader had "useful and constructive" talks with a US special envoy in Moscow over bringing more than three years of war in Ukraine to an end.
fullContent: A top Kremlin aide says President Vladimir Putin and US President Donald Trump will meet in the "coming days" after the Russian leader had "useful and constructive" talks with a US special envoy in Moscow over bringing more than three years of war in Ukraine to an end. Putin's foreign policy adviser Yury Ushakov said on August 7 that preparations for the meeting had begun and the two sides had already agreed on the venue "in principle." "At the suggestion of the American side, an agreement has been reached in principle to hold a bilateral summit…
